characters: OPEN YOUR GODDAMNED MOUTH OR I'M GONNA
SERGEANT JEFF TALLEY AND LT. MURRAY LEIFITZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is overlaid with the slow whup-whup-whup of an LA helicopter flashing through the frame, here and gone. LAPD radio transmissions crackle like static electricity around a dirty clapboard bungalow that looks like the puckered asshole of Eagle Rock. A man's terrified voice screams invisibly from the house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill this dog!  You make my wife talk to me or I'm gonna shoot this fuckin' dog! A five-member SWAT tactical team appears out of nowhere-- black assault gear, M5s, gloved and masked--hustling into position on either side of the front door.  Only now do w get the full picture:  Helicopters overhead, radio cars surrounding the house, an army of cops itching the pull t trigger -- When the tac team is good to go, the team leader gives a thumbs-up to --

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT JEFF TALLEY AND LT. MURRAY LEIFITZ
dialogues.text: Talley and Leifitz are hunkered behind the LAPD Command a Control van.  Leifitz is the Crisis Response Team SWAT  commander; Talley, the primary negotiator.  It's so hot o here that Talley has stripped down to a tee-shirt and ves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're good to go, Talley.  Your word, and we're in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's going anywhere, L-T.  We can talk this guy down. Talley lifts a dedicated crisis phone that's been hardlin into the house, his tone reasonable and friendly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hey, George?  George, don't kill the dog, okay?  We don't want to hear a gun go off in there. A phone crashes through the window and lands in the front yard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming from the house) Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he wants to talk. Frustrated, Talley slumps back against the van as the SWA Intelligence Officer, Lloyd Keith, scuttles up to them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the guy's wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't take the kid to her sister's. The neighbors were wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, you said we had her.  I told him we had her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got bad information, Talley.  I can't pull her out of my ass! Up at the house, George Edward Malik steps into the windo Malik is a forty-year-old freaked-out loser who has turne the corner on insanity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting at Talley) You said my wife was gonna talk to me, you lying fuck!  I'm gonna kill her dog, then shoot myself!  I mean it! Talley stares at Malik, thinking, then abruptly grabs Kei by the collar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Keith) Pull the dog's name out of your ass.  Get the dog's name. Talley steps out from behind the command van so that Mali can see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed by Talley's move) Talley!  You're in the line of fire! Talley ignores Leifitz; he is totally focused on Malik an defusing the situation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't lie to you, George.  You scared your wife pretty good last night.  We're having a hard time finding her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She better talk to me!  I'm gonna kill her goddamned dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I have been talking for, what,  sixteen hours?  Keep talking.  Is that your dog, too? Malik steps away from the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know whose dog it is.  She lied about everything else, so she probably lied about the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're hurting.  You lose your job, you find out your wife's fucking another guy . . . but don't give up. We'll have her talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why won't she open her mouth?!  Why doesn't the bitch say something???  Something about Malik's statement bothers Talley.  The wording is odd, suspicious --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George?  Come back to the window.

dialogues.speaker: STOP LOOKING AT ME
dialogues.text: Talley grows even more concerned.  Was Malik talking to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George?  Leave the dog alone and come to the window. Talley sees Keith rejoin Leifitz --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Leifitz) What's the dog's name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighbors say he doesn't have a dog. The pieces fall into place for Talley:  The wife that no can find, the dog that doesn't exist....

dialogues.speaker: SHOOT THIS DOG
dialogues.text: In a single terrible moment, Talley realizes that Malik i not talking to him; he's talking to his wife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murray!!  They're in the house!  His wife's in the house! Even as Talley screams, a gunshot echoes from the house, freezing the moment.  A second shot follows the first as tactical team breaches the front door -- Talley sprints forward, running as hard as he can in nightmare slow motion --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley shoulders inside on the heels of the tactical team through drifting gun smoke and lancing sunlight.  SWAT co are cuffing Malik even though he's already dead of a self inflicted gunshot wound; Malik's wife is sprawled on the couch where she has been dead for fourteen hours; two tac officers are trying to stop the geyser of arterial blood sprays from the neck of Malik's nine-year-old son even as of them screams for the paramedics -- Talley is numb; it's all too much, too heavy, too horribl He kneels between to the tactical cops and takes the boy' hand.  He stares into the boy's eyes, and the boy stares back.  The child's face grows pale as he drains of blood. hear his heart beating.  We hear it slow.  We hear it sto Talley stares at the dead boy.  The dead boy's lifeless e stare at nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TITLES
dialogues.text: Another hyperblue sky, but now we're in an upscale bedroo community in the sun-scorched high desert north of LA -- A legend appears:  One Year Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rotted-out Toyota pickup lurches to a stop alongside th minimart, white-boy hip-hop booming on the radio which di with the engine -- Dennis Rooney is driving; twenty-three years old, working class desert trash with a high opinion of his own broodin good looks.  In the middle: Kevin Rooney, nineteen, scare shitless at what they're about to do.  Riding shotgun:  M Krupchek, twenty-four, a large pasty guy with a shaved he and faraway eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Dennis, this is stupid.  I thought we were gonna go to the movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins past Kevin to Mars) Mars?!  Whattaya think, dude?  Out here on the edge, no one around, it's perfect, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check it out. Mars slides out of the truck.  He has a tattoo on the bac his tattoo that says:  BURN IT. As soon as Mars is gone, Dennis frowns at Kevin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to act cool, okay?  He's gonna think you're a dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbing this place is gonna put you back in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if they don't catch us, Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got jobs, man; we're working.  Why even take the chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if you don't take the chance, you're already dead. Dennis pulls a pistol from his pants to check the magazin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds, we'll be down the road. Thirty seconds.  Then we'll go to the movies. Mars returns and nods his approval --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect. That's all it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior Kim, Jr., is short, squat, and forty-two years old He's reading a magazine behind the counter when Dennis an Mars enter; Dennis trying to disarm him with a smile -- As Dennis reaches the counter, he lifts his tee-shirt to reveal the butt of his pistol --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pack of Marlboros for my friend and all your cash, you gook motherfucker! But Junior Kim is ready.  He lurches to his feet, bringin a pistol of his own --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a gun! Dennis lunges across the counter, grabbing Kim's gun, and two men are suddenly locked in a ferocious death-struggle possession of the weapon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars, help me -- Dennis and Kim bounce from the counter to the Slurpy mach the Glock locked between them, pointing first one way, th the other, their eyes meeting as -- BAM -- the gun goes o Junior Kim's eyes widen.  Dennis and Junior both look dow the red blossom that grows on Junior Kim's chest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming in the background) Dennis!  Dennis, someone's coming! Kim falls into the Slurpy machine, then slides to the flo Dennis scrambles over the counter and sprints for the doo But Mars hesitates.  Instead of running, he picks up Kim' gun, then leans over the counter to look at Kim's body. cannot see his face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forty-something soccer mom named Margaret Hammond is ab to enter the minimart when Dennis and Kevin burst out, knocking her on her ass.  Mars follows a moment later -- Margaret watches their red pickup lurch away, then rushes into the store --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis power-shifts into gear, clashing tortured metal as pushes the Toyota as hard as it will go.  No one is talki they're screaming --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's fuckin' blood all over you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know he would have a gun!  It just went off! Dennis sees himself in the rearview mirror.  His face is  splattered with red dew, the sight of it freaking him out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!  Fuckin' Jesus, it's on my face! The trunk careens crazily off the road.  Mars calmly runs hand over Dennis's face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax.  It's only blood. Dennis upshifts hard again, the truck lurching as the tra howls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK you, Mars!  I got it all over me! -- whereupon the tortured transmission gives with a loud and the truck loses power --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MotherFUCKING piece of SHIT!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flanders Road is lined with trees, hedges, and the exclus housing developments that dot the countryside around Bris Camino. The Toyota jerks to a stop well off the road, and Dennis, Mars, and Kevin pile out, stuffing pistols and bullets in their pockets --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That woman's gonna call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, goddamnit!  Just calm down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he's dead?  What if you killed him? Dennis grabs him by the throat; Mars steps between them -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are looking. Dennis sees that Mars is right; people in passing cars ar looking.  He releases his brother --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we gotta keep going.  I'm not gonna go in for murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on foot.  We can't get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're surrounded by houses, dumbass. Every house has a car in the garage. All we have to do is take one. Dennis and Mars take off for the wall, Kevin reluctantly following --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera reveals a two-story California Mediterranean h in the exclusive housing development known as York Estate You can't get in the door for less than one-point-five, a this house costs more:  Eight thousand square feet of use brick and custom tile set on a lushly landscaped acre --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can pick them up whenever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Smith is at his computer behind his desk.  He's fo and fit, casually dressed with thinning hair and glasses, currently leaning back as he talks on his phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) I have his corporate and personal on two disks, labeled Marlon and Al. As Smith talks, he ejects a Zip disk from his computer, attaches a label reading Al, then places it in a palm-siz case beside the first disk, Marlon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you don't have a sense of humor? He's going to love it. Walter's ten-year-old son, Thomas, suddenly charges aroun the desk and pulls at his father's arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stomach is eating me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Yeah, that's Thomas, the human piranha. I have to feed the animals while Pam's in Florida with her sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stomach has teeth!  It's eating my guts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still with the phone) Listen, is Glen on his way?  Great.  The paper's bagged and ready to go.  Bye. (hangs up; then) All right, all right, all right--it's  feeding time! Walter allows his son to pull him around the desk to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boom box blasts the latest teendiva megahit as Walter's sixteen-year-old daughter, Jennifer, stretches out in cut shorts and a bikini top, working on her tan. Walter and Thomas appear in the French doors that open fr the back of the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Jen!  Come feed your brother!  He's wasting away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we send him to Florida?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen, c'mon, chop-chop!  I've got to finish my work! Jennifer rolls her eyes, rises from the chaise longue, an pads to the house.  As she clears the frame, the camera swings toward the overgrown wall at the edge of the prope Dennis silenty drops into the bushes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sky blue Bristo Camino patrol car cruises along Flander Road --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welch is a young officer with an innocence to his eyes th you don't find in urban cops.  He keeps a photo of his wi and toddler son taped to the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four, base.  You there, Mike? Welch picks up the radio microphone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four.  I'm gonna hit the Krispy-Kreme. You want a dozen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed robbery, Kim's Minimart on Flanders Road, shots fired with a man down. This is so unexpected that Welch waits for the punchline

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, suspects are three white males driving a red pickup last seen eastbound on Flanders. Welch turns on his lights just as he sees the red Toyota pickup abandoned on the side of the road and stands on hi brakes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Smiths' home sports an open floor plan with the kitch centrally located between a large family room, a hall tha leads to the front of the house, and the French doors tha open onto the pool area. Jennifer is putting the finishing touches on three tuna sandwiches as she calls to her brother --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Daddy that lunch is ready. (no answer) Thomas, don't be a turd.  Tell --! She turns to find herself face-to-face with Dennis, who clamps a hand over her mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I'm not going to hurt you. Mars is holding Thomas.  Kevin is by the French doors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop fighting.  Relax, and I'll let go. Jennifer struggles until she sees that Mars is holding a pistol to Thomas's head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better.  Be cool and we'll be outta here in five minutes.  Understand? Jennifer nods, and Dennis removes his hand.  He has her pinned to the counter, his body pressed into her's; she i suddenly very aware that she is almost naked --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else is here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father. Dennis grabs her hair and pulls her away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens fast:  Dennis shoves Jennifer into the room, a Mars and Kevin follow with Thomas -- Walter is feeding a computer print-out into a paper shred as they burst through the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your ass in the chair!  Sit down! Dennis shoves Jennifer to the floor and stalks directly across the room, his gun trained on Walter. Walter freezes, hands motionless, letting the paper feed the shredder.  Strangely, he has little outward reaction

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Jen?  Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be dead if you don't put your ass in that chair! Walter carefully sits.  He is amazingly calm in the face this invasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin!  Don't stand there, asshole, close the windows!  Mars, keep him covered, dude! Mars pushes Thomas down beside Jennifer, then aims his gu Walter.  Kevin closes the shutters as Dennis rips the  electric cord from a lamp --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who sent you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go Rambo and you'll tell'm about this on the back nine.  I'm gonna tie you up, then we're gonna take your car. Walter glances toward the shredder; the final page of pap emerges as spaghetti and then the shredder stops --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car.  All you want is the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I talkin' raghead?!  I want your car! Gimme the goddamned keys! A strange smile flickers at the corner of Walter's mouth if there's a joke within all this, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The keys are on the wall by the garage. Take it.  The tank's almost full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis!  The cops! Dennis rushes to the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike Welch climbs out of the patrol car and keys his shou mike as he appraises the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his radio mike) They had to go through the yard at 455 Castle Way.  I'm going to approach. Welch slowly moves up the walk toward the front door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis shoves Jennifer to the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it!  You remember I'm right here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welch is halfway up the walk when the door opens and Jennifer, clearly terrified, peers out.  Welch hesitates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mike) Teenage female opened the front door. (to Jennifer) Miss, I found an abandoned vehicle on the other side of your wall.  Did three young men run through the area? Jennifer doesn't answer.  Her eyes fill until two huge te roll down her cheeks.  Welch grows uneasy.  Something is wrong, but he doesn't know what.  He stays where he is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't . . . see anyone. Welch stares into Jennifer's eyes, pointedly shifting his gaze to ask the silent question:  Are they here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are peering out the shutters when -- Mars suddenly shouts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going for his gun! Mars opens fire, shooting through the window as --

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: kicks the door closed and fires through the door, Jennife screaming, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tumbles backward, struggling weakly to pull his gun as bl bubbles in his mouth.  He tries to rise, but can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his radio) Officer down.  Jesus, I've been shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike?  Mike, what did you say?! Mike Welch blinks at the sky, but cannot answer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the kind of small-town police facility you might exp A general room with desks and computers, a coffee machine and a desk officer who thinks that crime is two teenagers egging a house. The camera establishes the low-key atmosphere, during whi it finds a glass door labeled J. Talley, chief of police

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff Talley is behind the desk, his voice muted because h locked in a painful phone conversation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) It's really hard, Jane.  This isn't the way I want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane Talley is an attractive woman in her mid-thirties. has the efficient manner of a registered nurse, which she and right now she's using all of her professional detachm to keep herself together --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) No?  Then whose idea was it for you take a job in the middle of nowhere? Intercut Talley, who considers the photographs that decor his wall:  Shots of Talley in happier times with Jane and their teenaged daughter, Amanda; Talley as a young SWAT officer; the framed headline from the Bristo Weekly Stand proclaiming:  EX-SWAT COP NEW BRISTO CHIEF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to work out some stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hiding, Jeffrey.  You're hiding from the job and you're hiding from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still see that boy's eyes. Jane softens; she knows that a part of him is in terrible pain.  But she's in pain, too --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That happened a year ago.  You've been gone for almost six months.  How long do you have to punish yourself for something that wasn't your fault? Talley studies the picture of his wife and daughter.  He focuses on Amanda --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Amanda there? Jane cups the phone and calls to her daughter.  Amanda en and goes to the refrigerator.  She's fifteen and carrying weight of a seriously bad attitude --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Amanda) It's Dad.  He wants to speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't even glance over) I'm gonna see him later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to Talley) She has to go to the bathroom. Jane turns away and lowers her voice, not wanting Amanda

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not only punishing yourself, Jeff. Amanda and I are in this, too. Talley knows, and he hurts like hell because of it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk some more when you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see you in a couple of hours. Jane hangs up without waiting for a response, then closes eyes, trying hard to keep herself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna go up there.  I want to  stay here with my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pack your things.  You're going. Jane stalks away without a glance back, and Amanda angril flips off her mother --

dialogues.speaker: WITH TALLEY
dialogues.text: He is clearly shaken by the call, but his thoughts are interrupted when his assistant, an older woman named Loui Vance, bursts in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's been shot!  Someone shot Junior Kim, too -- Talley comes around his desk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, shot?  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three white males shot Junior.  Mike followed them to York Estates --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: York Estates.  Four-five-five Castle Way. Anders and Jorgenson are on the way. Talley charges out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley wheels into a wide, spacious cul-de-sac lined with expensive estate homes, and pulls up behind another radio car.  Anders and Jorgenson are crouched in the street -- Bullets snap into Talley's windshield, starring the glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch. Talley scrambles out of his car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley takes cover behind his front wheel.  Anders and Jorgenson are young guys; they've never worked a high-cri area; they've never made a felony arrest; and right now they're scared shitless. Mike Welch lies on the Smiths' front lawn, forty feet awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welch is down!  They shot him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think it's the three guys who robbed Kim's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are civilians inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said something about a girl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holster your guns! Another shot cracks from the house as we hear the faint w of approaching sirens.  Talley edges around his car, tryi to see Welch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Mike!  Mike, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shout, Larry.  I'm three feet away. Talley considers the situation and comes up with a plan -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to cordon off the streets, then evacuate these houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do about Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your head down. Talley scrambles back into his car.  He backs up, then po the car up the drive and onto the front lawn --

dialogues.speaker: WITH WELCH
dialogues.text: Talley roars to a stop between Welch and the house, using car as a shield.  More shots ping off his car as Talley climbs out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, buddy?  You still alive? Welch moans.  His shirt is soaked with blood where the bullets caught him beneath his vest.  Talley can't waste time.  The siren is closer now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  You hang on. Talley hoists Welch into the backseat, then dives behind wheel.  He fishtails off the lawn and up the street --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance waits as Talley powers to a stop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the backseat! Paramedics pull Mike Welch from the car as Talley gets ou He can see into the cul-de-sac from here, where Anders an Jorgenson still hunker behind their car.  Talley keys his radio --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Talley.  Who's on? His radio crackles with overlapping voices --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One at a time!  Clear the air! (as they settle) Louise?  Talk to me.  What do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior Kim was DOA at the hospital. Frantic voices once more overlap --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Mike?  Is Welch alive?  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcefully) Quiet!  I want radio discipline. (as they quiet) Mike's hanging in.  Larry, Jorgy?  Listen up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out who lives at four-five-five.  We gotta know who's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief?  Mike said a young girl answered the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say if she was shooting at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant) He didn't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we don't know if she's part of this or not.  Mickey, you up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're out two minutes, me and Dreyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike found a red pickup abandoned on Flanders.  You see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right in front of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run a DMV on the plate for the owner's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pulled Mickey and Dreyer off the minimart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Louise, we can't leave a crime scene like that.  Put a unit out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only have eight officers on duty, Chief. More sirens are approaching, but their help seems too lit too late.  Talley stares up the cul-de-sac at the Smiths' house as if this was a terrible nightmare --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) That's not enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, Chief?  Say again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get everyone out here.  Then call the Sheriffs.  Tell them we have a possible hostage situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunsmoke fills the air.  Kevin is freaking.  He throws a magazine at Mars --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could've gone out the back!  You didn't have to shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  They found the truck, Kev! They're already behind us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should give up.  All we're doing is making it worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of our house! Her voice cuts through the din. Jennifer and Thomas are huddled with their father on the floor, Jennifer's arms crossed to cover herself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Quiet, Jen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't they go?!  Why don't they leave us alone and go?! Dennis charges up to her, screaming and waving his gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  Shut the fuck up! Walter Smith slowly stands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of you will get out of this. Dennis spins toward Walter, leveling his gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down!  Stay down, goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to my desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not goin' anywhere!  Get on the fuckin' floor! Dennis raises the gun to Walter's face.  Walter is in complete command of himself and nowhere near scared, but Jennifer grabs his legs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually; to Dennis) Take it easy, son.  I'm only going to my desk. Walter eases past Dennis, who doesn't know what to do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have contacts in Los Angeles.  Lawyers and judges who can help you. Walter slips open the center drawer.  Dennis thinks that Walter might go for a gun.  He screams louder and aims between Walter's eyes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll fuckin' kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!  Please! Walter checks that the computer disks are in the disk cas We can see their names clearly:  MARLON and AL.  He drops case into the drawer, then lifts out a thick booklet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is every criminal lawyer in  California.  If you give up now, right  now, I'll buy you the best lawyer in the state. Dennis slaps the book aside, even more angry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just killed a cop!  We killed a fat chinaman!  We'll get the death penalty! Dennis suddenly screams at Mars and Kevin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars, watch the cops!  Kevin!  Watch the back of the house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't die if you let me help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you stay in this house, I can promise you this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over him) Shut up!  Shut up and get on the floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't imagine the fucking you're going to get. Dennis snaps.  He swings the gun hard and smashes Walter the temple.  Walter drops like a rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone!! Jennifer rushes to her father's side, but Walter's out co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley is at his car with Anders and two other officers, Leigh Metzger, a woman in her early thirties, and Cliff Campbell, a slender guy who looks like a retired security cop.  Talley is getting information reports both in perso and over the radio --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to notes) The house belongs to Walter and Pamela Smith.  They've got two kids, a girl about fifteen and a boy younger, Jennifer and Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be the girl who opened the door.  Are the others inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother is in Florida visiting her sister.  The father works at home, so he's probably inside. Talley keys his mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mike) Louise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a phone number for the Smiths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the radio) Chief, Mikkelson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Mickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck is registered to Dennis James Rooney, white male, twenty-two.  He has an Agua Dulce address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contact the landlord.  I want to know employment, friends, family, anything we can find out about this guy. A news helicopter swoops overhead in a tight turn.  The c look up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly) News hawks.  There'll be more.  They monitor our frequencies. Talley realizes that his officers are staring at the helicopter as if they've never seen one; these people hav never dealt with a crime this large, and have probably ne even seen a felon.  Talley keys the mike again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone be cool.  That's our job right  now--stabilize the situation and don't  let things get out of hand.  All we have to do is hang on until the Sheriffs take over.  That's all we have to do. No one looks particularly convinced --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job, Metzger.  That's why I get the big bucks. Talley puts away his mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer and Thomas are bent over their father, wanting t help but not knowing how.  Walter's eyes flicker as if he dreaming, and the lump on his head is bleeding --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not waking up.  He should be awake. Jennifer abruptly stands and faces Dennis --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and sit down.  You think someone's gonna make a house call? Jennifer is scared--really, really scared--but she doesn' sit down.  Both Dennis and Mars are staring at her.  She feels naked and vulnerable.  She crosses her arms again -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least let me get some ice for his head. Dennis finally relents and shrugs at Mars --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure Kevin isn't fucking off back there. Jennifer hurries out as Mars follows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer goes to the counter.  Kevin is at the French doo nervous and scared; Mars is a dark shadow behind her -- She kneels to a low cabinet when Mars kicks it shut --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you wanted ice. Mars towers over her, his groin inches from her face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a wash cloth for the ice. Mars gazes down at her, enjoying his size and power.  He steps closer, bringing his groin closer to his face. Jennifer stands, holding her arms across her breasts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please get away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the background) Mars?  What are you doing? Kevin's intrusion shatters the moment.  Jennifer quickly snatches a wash cloth from the cabinet, then takes an ice tray from the freezer and brings it back to the counter - As Jennifer puts ice in the wash cloth, she sees the pari knife that she used for the sandwiches partially hidden b paper towels -- She glances at Kevin, but cannot see Mars; he's at the refrigerator behind her.  Jennifer slowly reaches for the knife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Jennifer freezes, terrified.  She pushes the knife behind Cuisinart to hide it, then turns.  Mars is offering her a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy won't know.  You can do anything you want right now.  Mommy won't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I want is to help my father. Jennifer hurries past him and disappears down the hall. as she leaves the phone starts ringing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone seems to ring louder here.  Dennis stands over watching the phone as if it's alive.  The phone rings aga and again.  Finally, he answers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley is once more behind his car.  He's on his cell pho with Jorgenson nearby --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) My name is Jeff Talley.  Is this Dennis Rooney? Intercut Dennis on the phone in Walter's office --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You with the cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bristo Police Department.  Look out the window.  You see the car? Dennis peers through the shutters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'm Rooney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had an awful lot of shooting.  You need a doctor in there? Dennis shoots a guilty glance at Walter, then lies --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me speak to Mr. Smith.  I want to hear it from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.  I'm running this shit.  You talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about your two friends?  You don't have a man dying in there, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fine. Talley cups the phone to tell Jorgenson --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three subjects are confirmed inside. Call off the house-to-house. (back to the phone) Okay, Dennis, I want to explain your situation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) You don't have to explain shit!  That Chinaman pulled a gun.  We wrestled for it.  That Chinaman shot himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Kim didn't make it, Dennis.  He died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis?  I want you to release those people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that.  They're the only thing stopping you from blowing us away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not coming in there by force, okay? No one wants to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got these people!  You try to come get me, I'll kill every fuckin' one of them! The phone clicks in Talley's ear as Dennis slams down the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is livid with fear and rage.  He paces through the office like a trapped cat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fuckin' Chinaman is dead!  That's murder-one, dude.  That's the needle! Kevin appears in the entry, drawn by Dennis's raving --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back where you belong, asshole! Mars, keep and eye on the cops; I gotta find a way out of here -- Dennis shoves Kevin out of the office and stalks after hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin dogs along beside Dennis, speaking softly so that M doesn't overhear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to tell you something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta find a way outta here is what we gotta do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Mars -- They reach the master bedroom suite, a huge room with sli glass doors that overlook the pool --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That cop didn't pull his gun.  Mars lied. He just started shooting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.  Why would Mars do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there, Dennis!  I saw!  It's like he wanted to shoot that cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being stupid.  Check out the bathroom.  Maybe we can sneak out a window -- Dennis shoves Kevin toward the bathroom, then steps into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One side is filled with racks of clothes, but the opposit side is an industrial bank of video monitors showing a do views of the house, both inside and out -- Dennis sees this stuff and stops in his tracks, awed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kev. Kevin steps in beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you totally stupid?  What does it look like? One monitor shows Mars and the Smiths in the office, anot the kitchen, another Jennifer's room, another the front o the house, the rear, the sides--every room and most of th exterior can be seen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, that's the master bedroom out here. Dennis goes out into the master, looking for the camera, appears on the bedroom monitor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see you! Dennis steps back into the closet, and this time he exami the door.  He closes it enough to reveal thick throw-bolt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, this is solid steel.  They gotta be hiding something. Dennis glances over to his brother, and finds Kevin on hi knees with two black travel bags beneath the clothes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis -- Kevin pushes the clothes aside to reveal an open bag.  It filled with hundred dollar bills.  Dennis kneels beside h brother and opens the second bag.  It's filled with hundr dollar bills, too --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're watching a grainy black and white security tape of Junior Kim's robbery/homicide.  It shows Kim behind the counter as Dennis and Mars enter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One in front is Dennis James Rooney. Talley, Mikkelson, Dreyer, and Anders are watching the ta which is currently being played in the home of Mrs. Estel Pena, who lives two blocks from the Smiths. Mikkelson is a tall, strong woman; Dreyer is her opposite short, dumpy man --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis has a younger brother, Kevin Paul-- that's him entering now, the third guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Dennis done time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just pulled thirty days for misdemeanor burglary.  He shows car theft, shoplifting, and DUI. Talley steps closer to the television, and taps Mars --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have still prints made from the tape. Show the landlord.  Maybe we can get a fast ID. Talley looks closer.  With the way Mars is positioned, we see part of the tattoo on his head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here on his head.  Is that a tattoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't make it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says...burn it. On the tape, Kim slumps to the floor.  Dennis vaults acro the counter and runs to the door.  Mars, however, calmly picks up Kim's gun and leans across the counter.  We coul see this before, but now we see a strange smile play over face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's watching Kim die. Talley watches Mars, and knows that this guy is seriously disturbed.  He is still watching the tape when Leigh Metz calls from the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief? Talley turns.  Metzger is with Amanda and Jane --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley, Jane, and Amanda are walking to the street.  Aman is excited; she thinks this is cool --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are men with guns really barricaded in a house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just around the corner and up that street.  See the helicopters? Five news choppers now hover high over the house.  The cr scene is only two blocks away.  Close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait by the car, Mandy.  Give me a minute with Dad. They wait until Amanda is gone, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologizing) I should've called.  This thing broke right after we spoke, then everything happened so fast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.  How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriffs will take over when they get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're not here yet.  Tell me about you. Jane touches his arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you're shaking. Self-conscious, Talley moves away so that he's out of rea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you guys grab some dinner at the Thai place?  I'll meet you there as soon as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how long I'll be stuck here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in no rush.  Maybe later we can talk. Talley gives her a gentle nod, then watches her walk away until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane? She turns back, her eyes asking 'what?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.  I love you anyway. Talley and Jane share the moment, and then she walks away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A news chopper swings by overhead bringing us to the main entrance of York Estates.  The entrance has been blocked, cars are being turned away, so traffic is backed up both along the street --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glen Howell is a nice-looking man in his early forties: Sport coat, gold Rolex, deep tan.  He hammers the horn of Mercedes S600 sedan, but it does no good; traffic is froz A news van trying to work up the line pulls alongside, th gets jammed by the crunch like everyone else.  Howell rol down the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys know what's going on? An attractive Asian-American reporter leans from her wind to answer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three men took a family hostage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, no shit?  My client lives in there. The reporter checks her notes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a family named Smith, Walter and Pamela Smith.  Do you know them? Howell stares at her emptily, then shakes his head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, I don't know them.  Thanks for your time. Howell pulls a U-turn to get out of traffic.  He flips op his cell phone and presses the speed dial --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) We have a problem out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a palatial home on the ridge overlooking Palm Springs.  On the cut, Sonny Benza, Phil Tuzee, and Charli Fischer are watching TV news coverage of the situation in Bristo Camino --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worst case, it's a bloodbath.  The detectives come out with Smith's computer, and we go directly to jail, do not pass Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Glen already picked up the disks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took the call from Glen personally. They're still in Smith's house. Fischer tries being positive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we're getting too dramatic.  It's three kids.  They'll give up, the cops will arrest them, and that's that.  Why would they search the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we should take that chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the spot) I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not, too.  How much information is in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith was cooking the books for the IRS. That means he has it all:  The cash flow, where it comes from, how we launder it, our split with the East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on two computer disks he calls Marlon and Al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, he's cute?  That's his idea of humor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the Feds get those disks, the East Coast is gonna take a hit, too.  You should let them know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  I tell them, that Old Man is gonna handle this from back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should warn them, Sonny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck them!  Now get your head in the game, Phil--we have to handle this. Benza turns back to the television --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put our people on the scene.  Smith might talk just to cut a break for his kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows better than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit--a man will do anything to save his family.  Who's running the show up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have a chief of police, a guy named Talley.  I saw him being interviewed. The television suddenly shows Talley making a statement. looks tired and haggard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Hey, that's him.  That's Talley right there! Benza studies Talley, then looks at his lieutenants --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out how we can hurt him.  By the end of the day, I want to own him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's happening right now. That's exactly what Benza wanted to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low-rent motel on the road between Bristo Camino and Newhall.  Glen Howell's Mercedes is parked on the side, a with several other cars. It's late-afternoon going into evening.  The sun is sinki fast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howell is being briefed by his operators, four men and tw women.  There's a minimum of bullshit; these people are professionals -- Ken Seymore is an intense, compact man who talks fast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L.A. County Sheriffs are inbound from a bank robbery in Pico Rivera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me an ETA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour, tops.  Might be sooner. Duane Manelli speaks up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Sheriffs get here, how many we looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking his notes) A command team, a negotiating team, a tactical team--the tac team includes a perimeter team, the assault team,  snipers, and breachers--thirty-five new bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many locals? Gayle Devarona, one of the women, leans forward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen officers and two civilians.  I have their names and most of their addresses. She tosses a yellow legal pad onto the table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Talley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Married but separated, ex-LAPD.  The fam doesn't live here, but they're coming up today.  I got his address there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops I talked to, they said Talley was a hostage negotiator in LA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His last three years on the job.  Before that, he was SWAT. Mike Ruiz joins in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's a SWAT negotiator make it up here to this shithole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I make him for a stress release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work, Gayle--everybody.  Now stay ahead of the curve.  I want to know everything that happens before it happens.  I'll cover Talley. Howell tears Talley's address off the yellow pad.  This meeting is over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it goes south?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If things get wet, we're going to need someone who can handle that end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worry about your end.  I got my side covered. Howell tucks the address in his pocket and goes to the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has set.  The donut shop glows greasily at the en a strip mall.  It is empty except for the overweight woma behind the counter and a lone man seated at a window boot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man in the booth is named Marion Clewes.  He's an ave looking guy, more or less, except for the strange cant to right eye and the thin black tie he wears over his white C. Penney shirt.  His jacket doesn't fit quite right, but so much as you'd notice.  Marion could disappear into a c just by being so ordinary.  That's the point. A fat black desert fly, heavy with juice and thorny with coarse hair, buzzes past -- Marion watches it, only his eyes moving -- The fly lands in the sprinkles of sugar on the table -- Marion watches it, then, suddenly, with no warning, his h flashes out, slamming down on the table. He holds his hand in place, feeling for movement, then sl peeks under his hand -- The fly oozes sideways, legs kicking, trying to walk.  On wing beats furiously; the other is broken -- Marion examines his hand.  A smear of fly goo and a singl black leg streaks his third finger.  Marion touches his tongue to the smear -- The woman behind the counter watches this, her eyes widen with disgust -- Marion holds the fly in place with his left index finger, uses his right to break away another leg.  He eats this l too -- The woman disappears into the rear -- Headlights flash across the glass, and Marion swivels aro to see Howell's Mercedes pull up -- Marion carefully pushes the still-alive fly aside as Glen Howell takes a seat across from him.  Howell puts the yel slip with Talley's address on the table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley lives here.  I don't know if the place has security or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a wife and kid.  That's how we'll get to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey-doke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to own this guy, Marion.  We don't want him dead; we need to use him. Marion puts Talley's address into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we make him dead after we use him? Glen Howell slides out of the booth without answering. Marion creeps him out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want.  Page me when you're done. Howell starts away, then turns back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donuts here any good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't eat junk food. Howell frowns like he might've known, then walks away. Marion turns back to the fly -- It lays there, still, until Marion prods it.  The remaini wing flutters -- Marion breaks off the remaining wing and eats that, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley and Leigh Metzger stride through a pool of street as she reports --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PacBell shows six lines into the house. They blocked all six like you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the only number that can call into the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  They'll only accept calls from your cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go. They arrive at Larry Anders, who is waiting at his car wi slim, nervous cement contractor named Brad Dill --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, this is Brad Dill.  Dennis and Kevin work for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know anything about this.  I didn't know what they were gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dill, these pricks didn't know what they were going to do until they did it. I want you to take a look at something. Metzger holds out a still picture that was made from Juni Kim's security tape --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you identify this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be Mars Krupchek.  Jesus, he works for me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Metzger) Have Louise run the name 'Mars Krupchek' through DMV and NCIC.  Tell her to list the tattoo as an identifier. Metzger hurries away as Talley turns back to Dill --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Krupchek an aggressive guy?  Hot- tempered?  Anything like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeps to himself, more like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have his address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty sure I do.  Yeah, here we go -- Dill pulls out a tattered address book.  Talley hands the book to Anders, who copies the address --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Anders) Call the Palmdale City Attorney for a telephonic search warrant.  When you get the warrant, have Mikkelson and Dreyer search his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Anders turns away as Metzger calls from Mrs. Pena's door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief!  The Sheriffs are ten minutes out! Talley has wanted to hear that, but now his sense of reli is tempered by something he did not expect:  Loss. Talley keys his shoulder mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his radio) Louise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Jane for me.  She's at the little Thai place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I'm almost home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is on the floor with the money, touching it, feeli it, smelling it.  Mars is standing over him, profoundly unmoved --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's gotta be a million bucks here. Maybe two million! Mars turns away from the money to consider the monitors a the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a safety room.  If anyone breaks into your house, you can hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit, Mars?  Check out the cash!  We're rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trapped in a house. Mars walks away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Mars are returning to the front of the house, Dennis irritated at Mars's lack of enthusiasm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can take it with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't run with suitcases. Dennis grabs Mars by the arm, stopping him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll stuff it up our asses.  This is the payoff.  This is every dream you ever had, all in those two bags. Mars continues on without responding, Dennis angrily following --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin is grimly watching news coverage of their standoff Mars and Dennis enter.  A female anchor is reporting on t events at York Estates with Dennis's booking photo cut in the picture --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the tube) -- thought to be Dennis James Rooney. Rooney was recently released from the Antelope Valley Correctional Institute where he served time for robbery. Dennis spots himself on television and breaks into a big smile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrilled) Check me out!  I look like fuckin' Jon Bon Jovi. Kevin is anything but thrilled --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone knows what we look like, Dennis.  We won't be able to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, first Mars, now you.  You two need anti-depressants. Across the room, Walter Smith shudders and moans; his fac swollen and covered with clammy sweat -- Jennifer is sick with worry and can't stand seeing her fa like this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father needs a doctor.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I've got a situation here, in case you haven't noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you're doing is watching yourself on TV.  Look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use more ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a doctor! Jennifer lurches to her feet and runs toward the front do Dennis catches her in two steps and backhands her exactly way his old man used to smack his old lady, knocking her the floor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen!!! Thomas charges into Dennis like an angry midget.  Kevin j between them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  Stop it, Dennis!  Jesus! Mars steps forward and jerks Thomas into the air.  Mars' physical presence is suddenly so imposing that everyone s fighting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) We should tie them.  We can put them upstairs out of the way. It takes Dennis a moment to come up to speed with that, b then he nods --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  That's a good idea, Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kevin) Find something:  Extension cords, rope, wire--we'll have to tie them tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find something, Kevin.  Don't just stand there. (waves at Walter) And tie this bastard, too.  I don't want him waking up and goin' Rambo on us. Mars nods his approval.  Subtly, there is the beginning o shift in power --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars pushes Jennifer inside.  Kevin follows her with duct tape and a couple of extension cords.  Mars, holding Thom pauses in the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie her to the chair.  I'll take care of the windows when I finish with the boy. Mars disappears with Thomas down the hall.  Jennifer stan by the chair, arms once more crossed over her breasts.  Kevin can see that she's scared.  He takes a T-shirt from where she's left it on the floor and hands it to her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  Put this on. She pulls it over her head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta pee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see why you can't just lock me in.  It's not like I can go anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either I'm going to tie you or Mars will tie you.  Which do you want? Jennifer sits.  Kevin pulls her hands behind the back of chair.  As he ties her, Jennifer decides that if any of t can be reached, it's Kevin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, my father needs a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just knocked out.  I've been knocked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If my father dies they'll charge you with his murder.  Can't you make Dennis see that? Kevin leans back.  He knows she's right, but he doesn't believe he can do anything about it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't make Dennis see anything. A shadow moves behind Kevin.  It's Mars, standing in the door.  He holds up a wicked claw hammer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I found. He enters and tests at Jennifer's binds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tied her like a pussy.  Make it tight. As Kevin reties the bindings, Mars rips the phone from th wall.  He smashes the phone jack with the hammer, crushin it.  Then he goes to the window and drives a heavy nail i the sill, nailing the window closed -- Mars returns to Jennifer and once more checks her binds -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better. He tears off a strip of duct tape and presses it over her mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure she can breathe. Mars rubs his fingers hard over the tape covering her mou He massages the tape into her skin, slow, sensual --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go downstairs, Kevin. Jennifer looks at Kevin, her eyes pleading that he not le but Kevin is cowed; he leaves -- Jennifer looks back at Mars -- Mars leans close to her.  She is terrified that he is goi to kiss her, but, instead, he sniffs, smelling her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to show you something. Mars hooks the claw hammer under his shirt and lifts to expose his chest.  A large tattoo in flowing script is li across his body:  A Mother's Son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It cost two hundred forty dollars, but I was happy to spend it.  I love my mom. You see these? Mars points out hard gray knots that speckle his chest as he were diseased.  He fingers the lumps sensuously as if touching them excites him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom burned me with cigarettes. Jennifer is both disgusted and terrified.  Mars stares at emptily for another moment, then lowers his shirt and lea without another word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark.  Thomas is tied firmly to the bed.  The cords cut into Thomas's wrists and Thomas can't reach the knots, but Mars made one mistake:  He tied Thomas to the headboard posts, and one of the newels has been loose for years -- Thomas stretches against the ropes to reach the newel, th twists it back and forth.  He works it harder and harder until the newel slides off its pin, and suddenly his hand free, though still tied to the newel -- Thomas peels the tape from his mouth, then unties the remaining binds and frees himself from the newel.  He sli off his bed and crawls along the wall to his closet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A service hatch that opens into the attic crawlspace is b into the wall beneath Thomas's clothes.  Thomas prys open hatch, then reaches inside for a small flashlight.  He fl it on, then climbs into the eaves of the roof --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crawlspace is a long triangular tunnel that follows t edge of the roof.  It was built for plumbers and air conditioning technicians, but Thomas has taken the space his own:  Witness the stack of Penthouse, pictures of spo heroes tacked to the rafters, and old soda cans strewn  between the joists -- Thomas scurries quietly through the tunnel, heading for -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas pushes through a hatch identical to the one in his closet, then creeps to the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Jen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer twists around to see him, mumbling through the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit still!  If they're in the security room, they can see you on the monitors. Jennifer quiets.  Thomas slips out of the closet and cree toward her along the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured out what these cameras can see last year when Mom and Dad went to Lake Arrowhead.  It can't see me over here, but it's looking at you, so don't move! Thomas reaches up from behind Jennifer and jerks the tape her mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!  Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet!  Listen! Thomas is hiding behind Jennifer so that the camera canno see him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That big asshole nailed my windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can use the crawlspace to get downstairs.  Then we can run for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I'm not going to leave Daddy with them! Thomas thinks about that and decides that he can't leave their father, either --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't carry him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go, Thomas.  You get out, and I'll stay with Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna leave you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!  If you get out, maybe you can help the police! Thomas suddenly realizes what he has to do --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll all go, Jennifer.  All of us or  none of us.  I know where Daddy keeps a gun. Jennifer jerks so hard that she almost tips over the chai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud) You leave that gun alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh, they'll hear you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) Better than you getting killed!  Don't touch that gun!  Daddy says -- Thomas slaps the tape back over her mouth.  Jennifer  struggles helplessly as Thomas slips back into the closet and is gone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff's Crisis Response Team rolls through the stre like an invading army:  A brown sedan leads a huge van kn as the Mobile Command Post, which is followed by a Sherif SWAT support vehicle, two SWAT Suburbans, and four radio  units. Pools of light from the helicopters follow their progress

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley walks out to meet the lead vehicle as the convoy stops.  Up and down the row, uniformed Sheriffs pile out their vehicles and off-load their gear -- Two people climb out of the lead car:  Will Maddox, a bespectacled African-American Sheriff's SWAT negotiator, Captain Laura Martin, the CRT commander --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Talley.  Who's in charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura Martin.  This is Will Maddox, the primary negotiator --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the perimeter around the house secure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got fourteen officers on my department including me.  We're as secure as we can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Martin) Permission to deploy the line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Maddox) Don't crowd the house.  The alpha's a kid named Rooney.  He's amped up and volatile. Maddox turns away to bark orders into his shoulder mike -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you know the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done it once or twice.  I blocked their phones to incoming calls, so you'll have to cut in a hard line to talk to  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder) Maddox!  You got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing it now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to Talley) I'd like you to brief my supervisors before we take over the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want. Talley and Martin hurry toward her troops --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage is dark, lit only by the light that comes from kitchen's open door, as Dennis, Mars and a reluctant Kevi enter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone should stay with Mr. Smith.  What if he wakes up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) That's why we tied him, dumbass.  Now come here and see this -- Dennis shows them a small casement window, and pushes ope the window to reveal a thick hedge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) These bushes follow the wall into the neighbor's yard.  All we need is some kind of diversion and we're home free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy, Dennis.  The cops will see us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if they're looking at something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's burn the house. Mars says it so simply that the moment is frozen.  Mars i holding the big claw hammer, kneading it as if it was a living thing.  His face is masked by shadows, but his eye both glow as if already reflecting flame --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Dennis, Kevin, and Mars through a slit overhead as they emerge from the garage and move back into the house Thomas is watching them.  He has cracked open the service hatch in the laundry room ceiling to make sure that his w is clear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark.  When Dennis and the others are gone, t ceiling hatch lifts, and Thomas lets himself down.  He sl onto the washing machine and then to the floor -- Thomas cups one hand over his flashlight and turns it on. lets light leak through his fingers so that he can see. beam cuts across a door to the garage, car keys on key ho and Jennifer's purse hanging from one of the hooks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a small room off the end of the laundry with a wo bench, a stool, and shelves above the bench for Walter's hobby supplies -- Thomas shines the light over the shelves, spotting the ha plastic pistol case on the highest shelf.  That's the tar that's the goal -- Thomas uses the stool to climb onto the bench --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is in the doorway to the security closet, handing one of the money bags to Kevin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't carry all this.  It's too heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been carrying you our whole fuckin' lives. Kevin drops the bag and tries to reason with his brother

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything we're doing is making it worse.  You can't let him burn this house. Dennis abruptly grabs Kevin by the throat, his face hard fury --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's worse than listening to you. I'm warning you, Kevin--stop holding me back.  Now you pick up that fuckin' money and get ready to go. Dennis glares at Kevin another moment, then lets go and s back into the closet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis lifts the second bag of cash when the monitors cat his eye:  The Sheriffs SWAT unit can be seen moving into position.  Dennis totally freaks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming!  Kev, Mars, they're coming!!! Dennis drops the cash and bolts out of the closet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars is placing two buckets of gasoline in the hall as De and Kevin pound down the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops are comin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the gasoline --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time! Dennis runs to the French doors.  He sees lights at the r of the property and SHOOTS through the glass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the kids!  They're our only chance! Dennis FIRES AGAIN and runs for the stairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas is straining to reach the pistol which is a fracti of an inch beyond his grasp when he hears Dennis shouting Thomas glances helplessly at the gun case--so near, yet s far--then scrambles off the bench and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas is climbing onto the washing machine when he once sees Jennifer's purse hanging on a key hook -- Thomas jumps from the washer, grabs the purse, then scram into the ceiling as GUNSHOTS ECHO through the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, Maddox, and her supervisors are gathered around Talley when the gunshots crack across the neighborhood --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Who's that shooting?  Martin, what's going on? Radio transmissions crackle over Martin's radio --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shots fired!  We are taking fire on the back wall! Talley immediately knows what's happening, and he knows w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're too close!  I told you not to crowd him!  Pull back your people; do not breach that house! Talley sprints toward the cul-de-sac --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas races through the narrow black tunnel.  He slips o the rafters and almost falls through the ceiling.  He's losing precious time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Mars pound up the stairs, getting closer to hi room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas pushes his way into his closet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Mars reach the second floor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas scrambles into bed just before Dennis jerks open t door.  Dennis drags him off the bed and carries him out o the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley, Martin, and Maddox run into position behind a Sheriff's unit where a deputy has set up the dedicated cr phone -- Talley grabs up the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the deputy) This thing good? Talley doesn't wait for the confused deputy to answer; he presses the button in the handle that dials the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in hell are you doing?  He's shooting at my men! The phone rings in Talley's ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Maddox) Then get your men off the wall! (to Martin) You breach that house, we're gonna have a bloodbath!  I know this guy, Captain -- I can talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Maddox) Order your men to stand down. The phone is still ringing.  Talley pulls the mike from t deputy's car and speaks over the public address --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the p.a.) Look out the window, Dennis.  We are NOT entering the house.  We're pulling back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
