dialogues.text: Dennis is holding Thomas around the neck, using the boy a shield.  Kevin is cowering on the floor and Mars is holdi Jennifer.  Dennis snatches up the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming into the phone) You fuck!  I got a fuckin' gun to this kid's head!  I'll kill'm, you fuck! Intercut Talley outside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over now, Dennis!  Don't hurt anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still screaming) We'll burn this fuckin' place down!  I got gasoline all over in here! Talley takes a deep breath; he forces himself to speak quietly, calmly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's coming in.  A couple of guys out here got carried away. Dennis peers out the front.  Talley's careful manner is calming him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamned right they got carried away. It looks like an army out there. Talley mutes the phone to speak to Martin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Martin) It's over.  He's cooling off. Talley glances at Maddox.  Maddox nods, his expression sa that Talley was right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back into the phone) I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a helicopter to take us to Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to happen, Dennis.  They won't give you a helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mexican police would arrest you as soon as it landed.  There's only one way out and you're doing it right now--just keep talking to us. (mutes phone; to Martin and Maddox) I think we could make the transition now. Maddox, you good to go? Maddox nods at Martin; he's good to go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dennis) Hey, Dennis?  Can I let you in on a personal secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta piss real bad. Dennis can't help himself; he laughs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a funny guy, Talley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to put on an officer named Will Maddox.  You talk to him for a while. Talley hands the phone to Maddox, who moves past Talley f better view of the house.  Talley looks grimly at Martin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he has gasoline set to burn the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  He must've siphoned it from the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you go in, you can't use tear gas or flashbangs.  The whole place would go up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not without humor) Looks like you're bailing out at the right time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returns her smile) That's why you get the big bucks, Captain. Talley is moving away when his radio pops --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keying his shoulder mike)  Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't find Jane.  She wasn't at the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have her cell number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They might be at the house.  Keep trying and let me know.  I'm going to be here a little while longer. Talley closes his phone and continues away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Kevin are at the television, watching an aeria view of the Sheriffs deploying around the house.  Jennife and Thomas are huddled by their father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're surrounded.  They're all over the neighborhood. Mars enters carrying candles and flashlights.  He lights candle and place it on a table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll cut the power. Mars tosses a flashlight to Dennis --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Jesus, not more of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him!  I think he's dying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kevin and Mars) Take'm back upstairs, but don't tie'm like before.  That little fuck untied himself anyway. Dennis returns to the shutters as Mars and Kevin take the kids --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars shoves Thomas into the room, then lifts the claw ham For an instant, we think he's going to hit the boy--but h smashes off the door knob, instead. Mars glares at Thomas, then pulls the door closed.  The k on Thomas's side is gone; there's no way for Thomas to op the door. But that's okay by Thomas.  He waits until he's sure that Mars is gone, and then he hurries back to his closet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas pulls open the hatch, fishes out his flashlight, t dumps the contents of Jennifer's purse on the floor. He picks up her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley closes his eyes with a blissful expression as a familiar sound fills the bathroom; he's taking a piss. His radio crackles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, base. Talley finishes his business, and keys his mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find Jane and Mandy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you call me back on your phone? Right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with the radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) Other people can hear us.  Just call. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by. Now Talley is worried.  He pulls out his phone and punche the speed dial.  It rings only once -- Intercut Louise, at her desk outside Talley's office --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong with Jane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a boy on the line.  He says he's Thomas Smith and he's calling from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a crank, Louise.  C'mon, don't waste my time with that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cell number belongs to the Smiths.  I think it's real, Chief.  I think this boy is inside that house. Talley worries it only for a moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him on. Talley pushes out of the bathroom into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flags Leigh Metzger as he cups the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Metzger) Get Martin.  Right away. As Metzger hurries away, we intercut Thomas, hiding in th shadows on his bed, whispering so as not to be overheard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) This is Chief Talley.  Tell me your name,  son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas Smith.  I'm in the house that's on TV.  Dennis hit my dad and now he won't wake up.  You gotta help him. Talley can tell by the tremor in the boy's voice--this is real --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, Thomas.  Take it easy and talk to me.  Was your father shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis hit him.  His head's all big and he won't wake up.  I'm really scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you and your sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my room. Talley hurries to a large sketch of the Smiths' floor pla laid out on the dining room table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's on the second floor.  Could you climb out your window if we were downstairs to catch you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nailed the windows.  I can't get'm open. Martin enters with Leigh Metzger.  Talley cups the phone give her the headline --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Martin) I've got the boy on the phone.  He's using a cell phone. (back to Thomas) What was that, son?  I didn't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I try to climb out they'll see me on the security cameras.  They would see you outside, too -- Thomas hears someone outside his door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming! Thomas hangs up, jamming his phone behind the bed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas?  Thomas...? Talley lowers the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says that his father's hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we have a man dying in there, we'll have to go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have security cameras.  Rooney would see you coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the boy say that any of them are in immediate danger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He said that his father's unconscious; he didn't say he was dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I think we should wait.  Do you agree? Talley finally nods --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to stick around, I could --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been here all day, Chief.  Take a break.  See your family.  If I need you, I'll call. Talley looks like the most tired guy in the world.  He no his good-night, then turns away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley slides into his car outside Mrs. Pena's home.  He' got a lot on his mind, and not all of it centers around 4 Castle Way.  He punches a number into his cell phone -- He listens to ringing, and then his own voice answers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jeff Talley.  Leave your name and number after the beep. We hear the beep, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) Jane?  If you're there, pick up, okay? Mandy? No one answers.  Talley closes his phone, his apprehensio increasing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bristo officers manning the gate swing the blockade a and wave Talley through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assembled television microwave vans, radio newsvans, reporters are parked together in an empty lot one block f the front gate. Ken Seymore steps into the street, speaking into a cell p as he watches Talley drive away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) He's leaving now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A traffic light on the outskirts of town, deserted until Talley's car pulls to a stop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, two masked men point guns at his head, one from driver's side, one from the passengers.  They're wearing jackets, black ski masks, and gloves.  The man on the passenger side sports a big gold Rolex, so we'll call him Watchman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning the gun) Do you see the fuckin' gun?!  Look at it! Talley freezes.  He's been blindsided by this insane shit but he knows better than to move --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy. The man on the driver's side gets into the backseat, then Watchman gets into the passenger side.  The man behind Ta hooks an arm around Talley's throat while the Watchman  searches for Talley's gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Chief.  I don't carry it. The Watchman nods at the backseater, who releases Talley. A dark green Mustang roars up ahead of Talley's car.  A  second car tucks in tight on Talley's rear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow the Mustang.  We won't go far. The Mustang pulls out, and Talley follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three cars turn into the alley.  They stop, the first last cars bumper-to-bumper with Talley's.  The cars are s close to Talley that his own vehicle is pinned; he couldn drive away now even if he wanted --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Watchman puts Talley's car in park, turns off the ignition, and takes the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're scared, but unless you do something stupid we're not going to hurt you.  You understand? Two more masked men approach from the other cars, one com to Talley's window, the other getting into the back seat behind the Watchman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't just fuckin' sit there, dumbass.  Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys are going to take hold of you. Don't freak out.  It's for your own good. The three men take hold of Talley, the man behind again looping his arm around Talley's neck, the other two each twisting Talley's arms --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? The Watchman holds a distinctive white cell phone to Tall ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff?  Is that you? Talley goes berserk.  He bucks and tries to pull away, bu the three men hold tight -- The Watchman closes the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to calm Talley) I know, I know--she's all right.  Your kid's all right, too.  C'mon, now, relax. From this point on, you control what  happens to them. Talley can barely breathe, they're holding him so tight -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we let go?  You past your shock and all that, we can turn you loose and you won't do something stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can let go. The Watchman glances at the men; they let go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the deal--Walter Smith has two computer disks like this in his house. They're labeled 'Marlon' and 'Al.' The Watchman holds up a thick black Zip disk.  Talley's expression tells us that this is the weirdest shit he's e heard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marlon and Al....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want them.  You will not let anyone go into that house--or anything come out-- until my people recover these disks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't control what happens.  The Sheriffs are running the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will re-assume command.  In two hours, a group of my people will arrive at York Estates.  You will tell the Sheriffs that they are an FBI tactical team. The Watchman puts the white cell phone into Talley's hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this phone rings, you answer.  It will be me.  I'll tell you what to do. When I have what I want, you get your family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want . . . Marlon and Al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have people in York Estates right under your nose.  If you do anything except what I'm telling you, you'll get Jane and Amanda back in the mail.  We clear on  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These disks . . . where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith will know. The Watchman and the others get out of Talley's car.  The doors slam shut.  The Watchman leans in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it rings, answer. The Watchman tosses the keys into Talley's lap.  We hear doors open and close; the cars, front and back, roar to l and speed away -- Talley focuses on the Mustang's license plate, franticall scratching down the number --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is deserted except for Louise, currently at her desk to monitor radio communications. Talley enters, looking as if he's stricken.  Louise can't help herself but to react --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look terrible.  Chief, are you all right? Talley barely glances at her, going directly to his offic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley steps inside and peels off his uniform shirt.  He takes a bullet-resistant vest and a black sweatshirt from closet.  He straps on the vest, then pulls on the sweatsh Talley sits at his desk and lifts out a ballistic nylon pistol case from the lower drawer. He takes out his old SWAT combat piece:  This isn't a pus 9mm; it's a finely tuned .45-caliber Colt Model 1911.  On shot, one kill.  Talley ejects the empty magazine, then l it with a deadly efficiency.  He slams home the magazine Talley clips the gun to his belt under his sweatshirt.  H ready to rock.  The camera finds the photograph of Talley during his days as a SWAT tactical officer -- He was one bad motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley heads for the front door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back to York.  Have Larry meet me at the front gate. Talley exits without a backward glance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopters orbit in the distance; the empty lot with news vans is in the background. Talley turns into the development, then stops at the side the street where Larry Anders is waiting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anders slides into the passenger seat.  He sees a differe Talley now, focused and grim --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Chief? Talley stares at Anders, trying to decide:  Can I trust h Will he rat me out to the Watchman and cost the lives of wife and child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I do something wrong? Talley gives him a slip of paper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to run this license plate and phone number.  Then I want you to find out everything you can about Walter Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to the office.  Run his name through the FBI and the NLETS database. I think he's involved with illegal activity or he associates with people who are. Anders glances at the slip again, then tucks it away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  Sure, right away, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell anyone what you're doing, not Louise, not the other guys, not the Sheriffs.  You understand me, Larry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck guessing.  You keep your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, Chief.  Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to work. Anders climbs out and Talley rockets away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley pulls up behind the Sheriffs' command van.  Martin surprised to see Talley, steps from the van --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm re-assuming command of the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin is surprised and angry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?  You requested our help.  You turned over command --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I'm taking it back.  We're getting Smith out of the house. Talley heads for the cul-de-sac --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is on her bed in the darkness, groggy with fear fatigue.  She hears someone outside in the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas? The door knob rattles.  Jennifer slides out of bed and go to the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas, is that you? The door suddenly opens, and Mars is framed in the dim li Jennifer jumps back, terrified --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't make the microwave work. That seems so outlandish that Jennifer is confused --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hungry.  You're going to cook. Mars grabs her hair, and pushes her out the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars shoves Jennifer into the kitchen.  Two frozen pizzas waiting on the counter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make the pizza.  I want scrambled eggs and hot dogs on mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) How about dog shit? Mars takes a carton of eggs and a package of hot dogs fro the refrigerator --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With hot sauce and butter. Jennifer takes a bowl from the cupboard.  When she sets d the bowl, she sees the handle of the paring knife by the processor.  Jennifer breaks eggs into the bowl --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a frying pan.  Would you get one? Over there, under the range. As soon as Mars turns away, Jennifer palms the knife and pushes it into the waist of her shorts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley joins Maddox behind the car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What put a wild hair up your ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed my mind.  That's all you need to know. Talley picks up the dedicated crisis phone that's been cu into the Smiths' telephone line.  He lifts the receiver a presses a button.  The phone inside the house rings -- Intercut Dennis inside Smith's office.  He answers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you, Talley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one and only.  We got a little problem out here, Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You oughta try on the problem I got in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to let me talk to Mr. Smith. Dennis shoots a nervous glance at Walter, who's twitching shuddering on the couch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We been through that.  Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't forget it.  The Sheriffs think you won't let me talk to Smith because he's dead.  They think you murdered him. Maddox can't believe that Talley is saying this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, so that Dennis can't hear) What in hell are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit!  The guy's right here! He's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pressing Dennis harder) If you don't let me talk to him, they're going to attack the house. Maddox grabs Talley's arm, his voice a low hiss --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna set him off, goddamnit! That's crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) They better not! Talley pushes Maddox away and amps the pressure on Dennis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me keep them out!  Let me speak to Smith, Dennis.  Let me speak to him right now. Dennis is freaking.  He believes that the Sheriffs are ab to crash through the doors --

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: Now Talley throttles back; he senses that Dennis is at th breaking point and wants to coax him back from the edge -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmer; coaxing) Talk to me, Dennis.  Help me help you.  Why can't you put Smith on the phone? Dennis finally makes the admission --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) He got knocked out.  It's like he's sleeping.  He just lays there. Talley gives a thumbs-up to Maddox, who sits back in awe. This crazy shit is working --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dennis) Now I understand.  That helps.  I can make them understand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me come get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that!  You bastards will jump me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you won't let me come in, then put him outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll cap my ass as soon as I step out the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already helped yourself once, Dennis; be smart again.  If you save his life, it'll help when you get to court. Dennis is at the edge; he's looking straight down into hi deepest fears.  He finally relents --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Talley, fuck you!  You and one other guy, but that's it!  I want you stripped!  I gotta know you don't have guns! Dennis slams down the phone -- Talley lowers the crisis phone, then looks at Maddox --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring up the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mobile banks of flood lamps illuminate the front of the house.  The ambulance waits behind the lights; tactical officers with M5s and M16s hunker in position in case the program goes south -- Talley and a paramedic named Bigelow emerge between the lights, wearing only shorts and shoes.  Bigelow is carryi collapsable stretcher -- They stop in the mouth of the drive with a full view of t front door.  Talley lifts his cell phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Okay, Dennis, we won't approach the house until you've closed the door. The front door opens, a crack at first, then wider.  The of officers behind the lights shifts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Easy.... Kevin and Mars waddle out with Walter Smith between them. They put him down about six feet from the front door, the return to the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bigelow) Let's do it. Talley and Bigelow move forward.  When they reach Walter, Bigelow opens the stretcher and locks out the frame.  He peels back Walter's eyelids and flashes a penlight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a concussion for sure.  I'm going to brace him. As Bigelow sets a cervical neck brace, Talley gets the cr feeling that he's being watched.  He turns toward the shutters, and finds a pair of eyes only inches from his o It's Mars. Talley stares at Mars, and Mars stares back.  It's as if  they're locked in a contest of wills until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get him on the stretcher. Talley turns away to help Bigelow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll support his head and shoulders.  You lift his hips and knees.  On three. Three. As they carry Walter away, Talley glances back at the eye Mars is still watching him --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CUL-DE-SAC--TALLEY AND BIGELOW
dialogues.text: are surrounded by cops as soon as they step into the shad behind the lights.  Another paramedic takes the stretcher from Talley.  Maddox is waiting with Talley's clothes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to tell me what's going on? Talley pulls on his pants --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Talley stalks straight to the ambulance, pulling on his sweatshirt as he goes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young physician named Klaus is examining Walter as Tall steps up into the ambulance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the chief of police here.  I have to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't gonna happen.  We've got unequal pupilation.  He could have an  intracranial hematoma or a fracture or both. Talley ignores the doctor and shakes Walter by the face -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith!  Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!  Stop that! Walter's eyes flutter, one more open than the other.  Tal leans closer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Smith) Wake up, goddamnit.  Who are you? Klaus tries to shove Talley away, but it's like pushing a wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man needs a hospital!  Stop it! Talley grabs Klaus by the arm, trying to make him see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use smelling salts, give him a shot,  whatever.  I just need a minute. Bigelow climbs behind the wheel and starts the ambulance. Talley pounds on the wall, shouting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the fuckin' engine! Klaus and Bigelow are both staring at Talley.  Sheriffs a Talley's own officers have gathered at the open rear of t ambulance to see what all the shouting is about -- Klaus pointedly looks at Talley's hand gripping his arm. speaks slowly, trying to make Talley understand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to wake him.  I don't even know that I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one question.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He.  Can't.  Answer. Talley stares at Walter Smith.  So close.  So damned clos Walter knows about the disks.  Walter might even know who Jane and Amanda.  But now Walter can't talk -- Talley turns away and climbs out of the ambulance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Talley emerges from the van, he pulls Metzger aside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you waiting in Smith's lap.  I want to know the second--and I mean the second--that he wakes up. As Metzger hurries after the ambulance, a phone in Talley pocket rings.  He's startled and scared; it might be the Watchman.  Talley takes out the Watchman's white phone, b it's not ringing. He answers his other phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Talley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, Chief.  Can you talk? Talley notices that Martin, Maddox, and the others are staring at him.  He turns away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) What'd you find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cell phone is registered to a jewelry store in Beverly Hills.  The phone company shows no unusual --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Dead end--it's a clone.  What about the Mustang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was stolen. Talley lowers the phone in frustration, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get anything on Smith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief...it's like none of this exists. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep trying. Talley pockets his phone.  He watches the ambulance pull away, then strides back through the banks of lights to th nearest patrol car.  He grabs the dash mike and keys the public address --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the p.a.) Call me.  If you're safe, call me. Talley's voice echoes across the neighborhood.  Every cop the cul-de-sac stares at him.  He has addressed the house for, apparently, no reason.  Dennis shouts from his windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be safe when I'm outta here, you asshole!  I'm not talking any more! Talley drops the mike without a word and walks away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howell is on the phone with Ken Seymore, watching the televised news coverage with increasing alarm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was Smith talking? Intercut Seymore, who is reporting from the York front ga as the ambulance roars away, siren wailing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard he's fucked up.  They're taking him to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, tell me what you know.  Did the cops go in?  Did Smith have the disks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Talley talked those punks into letting Smith out.  He's fucking us  over, Glen.  That guy is fucking us over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canyon Country. Howell slams down the phone.  He breathes deeply, taking moment to center himself.  He lifts the phone and punches number --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have another job for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley is by himself, pacing at the curb well away from t other officers.  He is holding his cell phone.  Waiting. Finally, it rings.  Talley answers, listens, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him on. Intercut Thomas, phoning Talley in his room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is my daddy okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors are taking care of him right now.  Thomas . . . are you safe?  Can you talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help with something.  But if you think those guys could catch you,  then I don't want you to do it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, Thomas; I don't want you to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad has two computer disks.  They have funny names:  Marlon and Al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has lots of disks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he was working on them today, so they're probably in his office.  Could you find them and see who they belong to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis won't let me go to the desk.  He makes me sit on the floor. Talley absorbs the bad news like his last best hope of sa his family is circling the drain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I might be able to sneak into the office if they're not around.  Then I could open the disks here in my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they locked you in your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get into the crawlspace from my closet and climb all over the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get into the office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get into the den.  The office is right across the hall. Talley thinks about what the boy is saying, and what he'l have to do to get Marlon and Al --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I get Rooney into the back of the house, can you find the disks without being caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Talley glances toward the SWAT Command Van as he comes up with a plan --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, Maddox, and several of her supervisors are gather outside the van as Talley approaches -- Martin sees him coming and steps away to meet him.  She's pissed off and she wants answers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what in hell you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for you.  I need your tactical unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stupid!  You can't get out of here fast enough, then you take back command; you agree to wait on Smith, then you risk everything in a stupid stunt to  get him out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Don't question me, Captain!  This is my crime scene!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over him) -- then when you get him, you damn near assault the man in the ambulance!  What is going on? Talley glares at her, half-a-heartbeat from going off, an then he throttles back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply) I'm a negotiator, Captain.  I negotiate. That's all you need to know.  Now are you going to help me or not? Martin weighs the determination in his eyes.  She's angry she's resentful, and she wants to knock Talley onto his a but, instead, she glances back to her van --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maddox!  Let's give the man a hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis steps through the double doors that open from the entry and admires the room--rich paneled walls, soft leat couches and chairs, and a lush beaten-copper bar.  Walter Smith's office is directly across the hall. Dennis saunters behind the bar, letting his fingers play the copper, then pours a stiff Ketel One on the rocks. Kevin appears behind him, watching, as Dennis takes a sea one of the leather bar stools, then peels a hundred off a thick roll and drops it on the bar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to an imaginary bartender) Keep the change, m'man. Dennis takes a deep drink of the vodka as Kevin approache

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fucked until we think of a way out; then we're rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For chrissake, please!  Help me celebrate!  I figured it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celebrate what?  Going to prison? Dennis enjoys another stiff belt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dumbass--Talley.  Talley's the guy who keeps us in here, and Talley's the guy who can let us out. Dennis grins as if he's discovered the wisdom of the ages

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops want to be rich like everyone else. All we have to do is share. (leans closer and lowers his voice) And if he wants someone to swing for the Chinaman, we'll give'm Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis. Mars is standing in the doors, large and ominous.  For an insane moment Dennis thinks that Mars has heard, but then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food's ready. Dennis grins, then shoves Kevin out of the room ahead of the three of them disappearing toward the kitchen as -- The camera drifts up to an air vent in the ceiling, throu the slats in the grate to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas watches them leave through a hole in the air duct. When he's confident that they are gone, he continues alon the crawlspace to a service hatch that opens down into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "wine cellar" is a climate-controlled closet behind t bar fitted with floor-to-ceiling wine racks. The ceiling hatch lifts, and Thomas climbs down the racks the floor.  He eases open the door and peeks out behind t bar.  The den is bright with light, and empty -- Thomas lifts his cell phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers into the phone) It's me, Chief.  I'm in the den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley, Maddox, and several tactical officers are lined a the rear wall, watching the house.  Talley, with a phone his ear, is looking through a night-vision scope -- He can see into the kitchen through the French doors.  Ma and Jennifer are inside, and, as we watch, Dennis and Kev enter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) Okay, bud, here we go. Talley hands the scope to Maddox, then keys his radio mik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his mike) Captain?  Kill the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Kevin are digging into plates of pizza and egg when the house goes dark --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  It's the cops! The backyard ERUPTS; explosions from Starflash grenades J and CAREEN over the swimming pool like New Year fireworks It sounds like World War III -- Dennis throws himself behind the kitchen counter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house now dark, Thomas scurries to the double doors. peeks around the corner to see if the coast is clear, the darts across the hall to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is lit only by the flickering candles.  Thomas checks his father's computer--no disks.  He searches thro the papers scattered over the desk, but finds nothing -- Then he opens the drawer -- The disk case that his father put there earlier is waitin Thomas opens the case -- Marlon.  Al. He found them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Starflash grenades burn out as Talley's amplified voi echoes into the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to talk face-to-face, Dennis. Come out, just you, and we'll talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?  What's going on?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars!  They're trying to blindside us! Check the front! Mars lurches to his feet and hurries to the office --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas is heading for the door when he hears footsteps co fast toward the office -- Thomas reverses course and ducks under the desk.  He pull himself into a ball and tries not to breathe -- Mars is in the room. The desk is a great oak monster, big as a boat.  It sits curvy legs that leave a gap between the desk and the floo Thomas can see feet -- The feet go to the windows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on out front? The feet turn toward the desk.  Thomas tries to squeeze himself smaller --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars?!  What the fuck are they doin'? The feet come to the desk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars!  Something's happening!  Get back here! The feet hesitate, then, finally, walk away -- Thomas scrambles from under the desk and darts across the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley approaches the house.  He can see flashlights movi in the kitchen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Dennis.  Talk to me. Dennis doesn't answer, so Talley moves closer.  He spread his hands wide --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm unarmed.  I'm looking at you.  Get out here and let's talk. Dennis comes to the French doors.  He stuffs his pistol i his pants, and opens the doors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a sniper out there, gonna shoot me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you try to grab me.  We could've shot you from the wall. Dennis considers that and accepts it.  He steps out of th house and walks over to Talley --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been in there a long time. What're you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you be in a hurry to go to prison for the rest of your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be trying to get the best deal that I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's what I'm doing.  Can I reach in my pocket, show you something? Dennis Rooney steps closer because he doesn't want anyone else to see the wad of money he pulls out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fifty hundred-dollar bills.  Five grand.  They got money in this house, Talley, more than you've ever seen. Dennis pushes the money back into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much would it be worth to you, getting me out of here? So that's what keeps Dennis in the house--money.  This is first that Talley has heard of the money --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You picked a bad house to hole up in, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred thousand cash, right in your pocket, no one needs to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a million dollars in there, maybe two million.  I'll give you half. Talley stares at Dennis, wondering how much to tell him a whether or not it will do any good --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man you sent to the hospital is a criminal.  He has partners.  This is their house and their money and they want it back. These simple facts settle on Dennis like a funeral shroud everything that Smith said earlier now makes a horrible sense:  You can't imagine the fucking you're going to get Dennis's eyes fill with defeat and helplessness --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't been a good day, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up, Dennis.  Let these people go. At least you'll have your life. Dennis steps inside and pulls the door closed, the darkne in the house swallowing him like dirty water. The power is turned on.  The house comes to life -- As Talley turns away, his phone once more rings --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas is hunkered with his computer behind his bed so th the camera can't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got'm! Intercut Talley, now back in the cul-de-sac --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you open them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I opened Marlon.  I think it's somebody's taxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look for names.  Does it say whose taxes they are? Thomas scrolls through a spread sheet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see any people names.  It's all businesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try Al.  See if you can open Al. Thomas changes disks and opens Al --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  Here's a name.  This is somebody's personal tax --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles G. Benza. (then; noise in the hall) They're coming! Thomas abruptly hangs up and the line goes dead in Talley ear. Talley recognizes the name as easily as an East Coast cop would recognize John Gotti, and realizes the stunning imp of Smith possessing Sonny Benza's financial records --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny Benza.  Oh, fuck. Talley sprints across the cul-de-sac to his nearest offic Jorgenson, and keys Jorgenson's shoulder mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the mike) Leigh?  Metzger, answer me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a guard on Smith!  I want you with Smith until I get there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car.  Now. Talley drops the mike and shoves Jorgenson toward the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion Clewes is stepping from his car as Talley's police unit rips into the parking lot with flashing lights -- Marion watches Talley and Jorgenson rush into the ER, the frowns and punches the speed dial on his phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) We're too late.  The police are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley and Jorgenson huddle in the hall with Klaus and th supervisor, Dr. Estelle Reese.  Metzger is outside Walter room in the background --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm posting a guard outside his room, but we'll need help from hospital security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is my staff in danger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with my officers here, no, ma'am. Metzger steps into Walter's room, then reappears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  He's waking up! Talley and Klaus press for the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's eyes flutter open.  His voice is slurred, but understandable --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I? Klaus peels open Walter's eyes, passing his penlight over one, then the other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canyon Country Hospital.  Do you remember your name? It takes Walter a few moments to answer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Smith. All of Walter's memories come flooding back, and he tries sit up.  Klaus forces him down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still in the house. Walter looks at Talley.  He has never seen Talley and has idea who he is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jeff Talley, the Bristo chief of  police.  So far as we know, your children are okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief Talley is the one who got you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Klaus) I need to talk to him.  Alone. This time, Klaus is hard-pressed to refuse.  He nods, the steps away -- Talley turns back to Walter Smith, and lowers his voice -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny Benza has my wife and daughter.  He wants the disks, Marlon and Al.  He took my family to make me help. Talley's eyes fill.  His tears drip on the sheets.  Walte looks away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to kill you.  Don't you know that?  He can't take the chance that you'll talk. Klaus returns and places a hand on Talley's shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another minute.  Please -- But when he looks back at Walter, he realizes that anothe minute will do no good:  Walter's eyes are once more clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley is pacing by his car in the deserted parking lot. pounds the hood, cursing, awash in rage and frustration - And then a phone rings. Talley takes out the phones.  The white phone is ringing. The Watchman's phone -- Talley answers furiously, the two of them instantaneously screaming at each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dumb fuckwad cop, you fucked up bad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm going to let you murder someone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a blowtorch on your daughter's pretty face?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go in that fuckin' house right now! I'll give those disks to the real FBI, you COCKSUCKINGMOTHERFUCKER!!  And I've got Smith!  I've got Smith!! A profound silence fills the parking lot, both men now purged.  When the Watchman speaks again, his voice is measured --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we each have something the other wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people are good to go.  You know who I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your phony FBI assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost home, you and me.  Keep your shit together.  This isn't L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean by that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want another dead child on your conscience. The line goes dead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is pouring another stiff glass of Ketel One --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have told him about the money.  Now Talley is gonna keep it for himself. Kevin joins him at the bar.  Mars is by the doors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said that? Dennis downs a big hit of vodka, then moves to the couch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't escape, we gotta get the word out about the cash.  That's how we'll stay alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way he can keep the cash is if nobody knows about it.  He's gotta cap all three of us before they even read our rights.  He's probably planning it right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy.  He's not going to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, you're so fuckin' stupid... Kevin follows his brother to the couch and stares at him; Dennis has clearly lost his mind, and Kevin has reached t end of his rope --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.  We have to give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it's over.  That money's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That money's fucked up your brain. Talley's going to get tired of waiting for us to give up, and we'll all be fuckin' killed! Dennis tips his glass, like a toast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we might as well die rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to die for this! Kevin slaps the glass away.  Dennis boils up from the cou He grabs his brother and the two of them fall over the co table, Dennis hammering Kevin in a furious rage until he out of gas --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my fuckin' anchor, Kevin, the fuckin' lead around my life that I've been draggin' like a cripple leg! Dennis gets up and steps back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this into your stupid head, Kevin. We're not leaving without the money. Beaten and whimpering, Kevin crawls away.  Dennis watches crawl out of the room, then looks at Mars --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it here, Dennis.  I'm never going to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A. Dennis returns to the bar.  When he looks around again, M is gone--melted into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is hiding in her shadows when her doorknob moves reaches pulls the knife from her shorts, keeping it hidde she backs away -- Kevin steps inside, leaving the door ajar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down.  I'm taking you and your brother out of here. Jennifer now sees the marks and cuts on his face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go or not?  I'm offering you a way out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go without Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three of us will go, but we have to move fast.  Mars and Dennis don't know I'm doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we get out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Mars are in the den.  I'll get your brother, then come back for you. We'll go down the stairs and out the front door, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Kevin goes back to the door, then considers her.  Maybe h wants to apologize for all this, but the best he can mana is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put on some shoes. Kevin slips out and pulls the door closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kevin emerges from the room, he comes face-to-face wit Mars. Mars is a great black shadow in the dark, only inches awa Kevin steps back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared the shit out of me.  I was looking for you.  Dennis wants you to watch the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you with the girl. Kevin takes another step back, but Mars follows him, stay uncomfortably close --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Mars.  If we stay the cops will kill us.  Don't you get that? Mars seems thoughtful, steps aside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it.  If you want to go, go. Kevin expected Mars to stop him, but Mars is letting him Kevin turns away and hurries down the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley is returning to the hospital.  As he turns into Yo Estates, he's stopped by one of his officers, Dale Cooper Talley rolls down his window to see what Cooper wants --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come FBI guys showed up, Chief.  They said you were expecting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They here now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see'm up the street. Talley nods, and continues through the gate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two gray Econoline vans are parked at the curb beneath a street light, four men in the lead van, two in the rear. Talley pulls up behind them, then gets out of his car.  H walks up the middle of the street to the lead van, eyebal the men in the vans:  They all have short haircuts and ar wearing black tactical fatigues.  Some of them wear ball that say FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Talley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The man in the passenger seat, Mr. Jones, gets out.  He l the part of FBI SWAT:  black tac fatigues, jump boots, bu hair.  A pistol hangs under his left arm in a ballistic holster --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see some ID.  Something with a picture.  I don't give a shit about your badge. Talley takes out his wallet and flashes his photo ID.  Jo does the same in return --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's mine.  My name is Special Agent Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are all of you named Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be funny, Chief.  You can't afford it. Jones slaps the side of the van.  Doors open, and the remaining five men climb out.  They strap into vests with emblazoned on the back, then pass out load-bearing gear, masks, and flash-bang grenades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a few minutes the white phone is going to ring.  So let's get our shit straight before that happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to be a cop.  All of you used to be cops.  I can tell by the way you move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about what we used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you people expect this to work? The Sheriffs have a Crisis Response Team here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you my name.  You just saw my commission slip.  What's my fucking name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Agent Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of me that way and you won't fuck up.  I'll handle the Sheriffs. The men at the second van are now passing out MP5s, CAR-1 and loaded magazines --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you people going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I are gonna straighten this out with the Sheriffs, and then we'll wait for the man to call.  When he gives the word, we move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he have on you?  I know why I'm doing this, but what does he have on you? One of the other men hands an MP5 to Mr. Jones.  Jones jacks the bolt to chamber a round.  He slings his gun wit answering --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Chief.  Time to get real. Jones walks away, and all Talley can do is follow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at the end of a gravel road in the low foothills of Pearblossom, a farm community of fruit orchards in the lo foothills. A Bristo Camino police car pulls up outside a thirty-foot Caravan trailer, and Mikkelson and Dreyer get out.  Mikke lights up the trailer with the radio car's spotlight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krupchek lives in a shithole. The trailer is dark and silent.  They walk to the door carrying their Maglites.  Mikkelson tries the knob --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we could jimmy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to pay for breaking it. Mikkelson pulls hard and the door pops open.  Both office cringe as a smell like simmering mustard greens rolls out them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, that stinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikkelson switches on the lights as they step inside.  Dr sees it first --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey?  Look at this shit. Mikkelson joins Dreyer in the trailer's tiny kitchen wher teetering stacks of folded cereal boxes fill the counters sink and floor.  Hundreds and hundreds of Captain Crunch Count Chocula boxes, all neatly folded and stacked --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's burned them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Dreyer shows her a box.  The nose of each character has b burned with a cigarette --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He burned their noses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, this is creeping me out. Mikkelson opens the oven.  It's empty.  She opens a cupbo It's filled with large glass jars.  She opens another  cupboard.  More jars.  Shapes float in the jars, suspende yellow fluid.  Mikkelson and Dreyer examine the shapes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are those, rats? Mikkelson opens the fridge, then slams it, looking like s wants to puke --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmigod.  We gotta call Talley. Dreyer sees the expression on her face, then looks at the fridge, wondering --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley, Jones, and Jones's phony "FBI" team are moving do the cul-de-sac toward the house with Martin at their heel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Smith is in the Federal Witness Protection program.  When Washington learned about the situation here, they asked Chief Talley for his cooperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit.  I should've been notified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you will be, Captain, but it's after midnight.  Now, if you'll pull your people off the perimeter, I want to get my people in position. Martin looks like she wants to spit bullets --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamned small town bullshit. Martin relents and stalks away just as Talley's phone rin Both Talley and Jones tense at the ring, thinking it migh the white phone, but it's not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mine. (into his phone) Talley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, it's Mikkelson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Mickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Mikkelson and Dreyer are leaning against their car. They look shellshocked.  Mikkelson is making the call --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, we just found Krupchek's trailer. We just went in there. She trails off and looks at Dreyer for help:  How do I sa this?  Dreyer, at a loss, looks away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has human body parts in his  refrigerator.  He has five human heads. Mikkelson can't handle it any more.  She lowers the phone

dialogues.speaker: WITH TALLEY
dialogues.text: The shock that Mikkelson is feeling sweeps over Talley as well.  He takes a moment to get his head around this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) Mickey?  Call the state Homicide Bureau. Don't touch anything, just sit back and wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Talley lowers the phone as he stares at the house, wonder what sort of monster is in there with Thomas and Jennifer His gaze shifts to Mr. Jones, who is watching him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting those kids out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is sprawled on the couch, sucking the last few dro of Ketel One from the bottle.  He frowns at the empty bot then lumbers to his feet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Kev?  Key, Kevin, c'mon back.  I'm sorry I hit you. Dennis weaves through the door, carrying the empty bottle like his dearest friend --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis staggers into the kitchen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Kev, don't fuckin' pout!  You're right.  It's time to call it a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin left.  He didn't want to be here anymore. The voice from the other side of the kitchen startles him Mars steps out of the shadows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean he left, as in went out the front door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I overheard him with the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  That fuck!  Even when I want to turn myself in he screws it up!  Did he  take the kids with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, get upstairs and find out!  If he took those kids, we're fucked! Mars cross the kitchen and goes for the stairs without another word --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEVIN!!!  You ASSHOLE!!! Dennis throws the bottle across the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas is scared by all the shouting, but he waits in the darkness until Dennis quiets, and then we notice that he no longer in his room; he's in the hobby room, once more trying to reach the gun -- Thomas stacks two phone books on the bench, then uses the phone books as an extra step to reach the high shelf -- He can finally reach the gun case!  He puts it on the ben then climbs down, and opens the case.  Thomas is bouyant confidence; now, he can protect himself and his sister! Thomas shoves the gun into his pants and creeps back into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas is climbing onto the washing machine when his foot slips and he bangs his head -- It's so dark in ehre that Thomas can't see what made him  slip, but he tests the floor.  His shoe makes a tacky sou Thomas cups his hand over his flashlight like before, and turns it on.  A dark liquid like oil is spreading on the floor. Thomas follows it with his light to the broom closet.  He lets out more light and sees that the oil is red. Thomas knows that something terrible is behind the door, he is drawn to it.  He reaches out -- Kevin's lifeless body topples out, collapsing in a heap a Thomas's feet.  His neck is cut so deeply that his head i almost severed -- His eyes are open. Thomas screams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is anxiously waiting for Kevin.  When she hears someone in the hall, she thinks that it's Kevin, but when door opens -- It's Mars. He steps inside, tall, wide, and massive as a bear.  He's carrying the claw hammer.  Jennifer backs away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin left without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. Mars turns off the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that.  Turn on the lights. Jennifer grows even more frightened.  Mars follows her ac the room until she backs into the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better get out of here!  Kevin's coming back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin's gone, your daddy's gone,  everybody's gone. When Mars reaches her, he touches the hammer to the chest pressing to make it hurt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we can do whatever we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. Mars rakes the claws slowly between her breasts as Jennif finds the knife in her shorts.  She jerks free the blade stabs blindly burying the knife high in his chest, but Ma doesn't even step back -- He grips the handle, moaning hideously as he pulls out th knife.  A red flower blossoms from the wound. Jennifer tries to get past him, but he grabs her throat a pins her to the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to enjoy this. He raises the knife to her face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scream from the laundry room having scared the shit o of Dennis, he has his gun out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?  Goddamnit, who's there? Dennis turns on his flashlight and sweeps the beam across kitchen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kev?  Is that you?  Talley? Dennis weaves across the kitchen, pushing the gun ahead o him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, if that's you, say something. Mars said you left. Dennis steps through the door into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis shines the light on the floor and sees the red ooz He follows the blood to Kevin's body, but even then doesn realize what he's seeing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin, what the fuck?  Get up. Dennis steps closer, and now he sees the open neck, the grotesque white bone within the flesh -- Only one other person in the house could have done this -

dialogues.speaker: MARS
dialogues.text: Dennis hears Jennifer screaming upstairs --

dialogues.speaker: MARS
dialogues.text: Dennis rushes from the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis slams through the door so heard that the door cras into the wall.  Mars is across the room, still holding Jennifer by the neck -- Dennis aims his gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead, you fuck. Mars calmly pulls the girl in front of him, blocking Denn aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Dennis?  Why're you so pissed off? It's weird the way Mars is acting, so calm and all.  But Dennis can see the feat in Jennifer's face and her swolle eyes.  She manages one word --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... Dennis tries to aim past her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fuck killed Kevin.  There's blood everywhere down there -- Jennifer sobs.  And when she does -- Mars charges across the room holding Jennifer like a shie Dennis hesitates only a heartbeat, and then it's too late Jennifer crashes into him, the full force of Mars's weigh behind her, knocking Dennis backward into the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fall through the door into a tangle on the floor.  M raises the hammer, then brings it down, smashing Dennis o and over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas emerges from the closet to see the carnage in the hall:  Mars over Dennis, grunting like a pig as he turns Dennis into pulp, and Jennifer crawling away, splattered blood -- Thomas pulls the gun from his pants and darts past Mars i the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas grabs Jennifer's arm and pulls her toward the stai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jen!  Run! Mars heaves to his feet and turns after them -- Thomas jerks up the pistol with both hands --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll shoot you! Mars stops, blood dripping from his face and hands and th hammer.  Jennifer pulls her brother --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going! They back toward the stairs, Thomas trying to hold the gu steady.  Mars follows, spreading his arms wide as if to embrace them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's gone.  We can do whatever we want.  We can do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll shoot you!  I'm not kidding, you better stay away! Mars keeps coming -- Thomas pulls the trigger.  Click. Mars stops, frozen by the sharp sound -- Thomas pulls again.  Click click click -- No bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!!!!! Thomas and Jennifer sprint for the stairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer and Thomas crash down the stairs and spill into entry.  Thomas goes to the front door but Jennifer pulls away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  They have everything nailed! They race away down the hall just as Mars reaches the bot of the stairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars is closing.  Jennifer and Thomas scramble through th bedroom only paces ahead of him.  They run straight into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer and Thomas slam the door and throw the bolts jus Mars crashes into the door -- Jennifer and Thomas have made it.  They are shaking and scared, but they are safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't reach us in here.  We're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Mars pounds on the door with the hammer.  They can see hi the monitors.  Slow rhythmic pounding.  Then he walks awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing? They can see him on the monitors--moving through the hall going into the entry.... Mars picks up a bucket of gasoline.  He splashes gas on t walls and floor all the way back to the bedroom, and then empties the bucket on the security room's door -- Mars looks up at the camera again and takes out a match. flicks it with his thumbnail and it flares --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmigod, he's going to burn us! Mars tosses the match, and the room erupts into flame --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley is arguing with Jones, trying to convince the man they need to move into the house now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get those kids out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until the man calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those kids are in there with a fucking psychopath!  He kills people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been in there all day. Talley's phone rings.  Again, they both think that it's t white phone, but instead it's Talley's personal phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) Talley. It's Thomas.  His voice cuts in and out, broken by static

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mars killed Kevin and Dennis!  We're in the security room.  He's burning the house -- Thomas' phone cuts out.  Talley turns toward the house an sees a growing column of smoke.  He looks back at Jones -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do what you have to do; I'm getting those kids. Talley hurries away.  Jones stares after him, then comes his own agonized decision.  He catches up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley!  We'll secure the house, but then we get the disks. Talley accepts that; they move toward the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banks of floodlights abruptly shut off, plunging the house and grounds into darkness --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is spreading, following the gasoline trail throu the hall and the rest of the house; a thick layer of smok covers the ceiling -- Mars sees that the outside lights have been turned off, a senses that the cops are making their move.  That's all r with Mars--he's been waiting to die for most of his life Mars checks the load in his pistol, then melts away into dark -- A moment later, throbbing music pounds the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley and Jones slip up to a side window at the front of house.  Both are carrying fire extinguishers.  They peer inside, then Jones uses a pry bar to lift the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley enters first, followed by Jones.  The air is thick with smoke, and the music is confusing; the hall outside room is filled with flames -- Talley points toward the bedroom, then uses hand signals countdown the launch--three...two...one -- Jones keys his throat mike to launch the strike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go -- They blast the flames with their fire extinguishers, then plunge into the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sliding glass doors shatter as one of Jones's men breaches the door.  As he rolls to his feet, Mars shoots from the flames -- A second man rolls through the door, and Mars shoots agai laughing as the man writhes in flames --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fight back the flames with their fire extinguishers, work their way into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an inferno as Talley and Jones come through the door They spot the two men on the floor just as -- Mars rears up behind the flames.  He is shirtless and  glistening, screaming maniacally is he fires his gun -- Talley and Jones fire in unison, pounding Mars with bulle and knocking him into the fire.  Mars thrashes and scream burning alive -- Talley hears pounding inside the safe room:  Jennifer and Thomas!  He fights his way to the security door, which is covered with flames --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, goddamnit, we can get the disks later! Talley expects that Jones will help, but Jones is aiming gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need you any more, Chief.  We can get the disks on our own. But before Jones can kill Talley, Mars heaves himself up the flames, firing wildly.  He hits Jones in the head -- Talley fires reflexively, his powerful .45 kicking Mars across the room and out the glass doors.  Talley turns ba to the burning door and douses the flames with his fire extinguisher --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas!  Thomas, it's me! Thomas and Jennifer jerk open the door, but shrink from t heat.  Talley uses the last of his fire extinguisher, the pulls them into his arms --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay close.  We're going to move fast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley shepherds Jennifer and Thomas past the flames --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the entry, and Talley uses his pry bar to brea open the door -- A wall of cops are out on the street, waiting --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thomas) Are the disks still in your room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  They're right here -- Thomas pulls Marlon and Al from his pocket -- Talley clutches the disks and pulls the boy close in a spontaneous hug.  They run out the door as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is resting comfortably when Talley steps up beside bed.  Talley is a mess--smokey, dirty, greased with sweat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Smith. Walter opens his eyes, then Talley steps away.  Jennifer Thomas are standing behind him.  They rush to their fathe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God!  Are you guys all right? You're not hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our house is on fire!  We almost burned! Both children burst into tears, and Walter hugs them.  He looks up at Talley, then gently eases his kids away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jennifer and Thomas) You guys step out for a second.  I have to talk to the Chief. Walter waits until his children are gone, and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find the disks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you have everything.  You can put them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches his wrist) A man has my family.  Gold watch here. Dark tan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be Glen Howell.  He was on his way for the disks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I reach him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley is alone in his car, his phone to his ear, listeni to the ring at the other end of the line.  A familiar voi answers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two words:  Glen Howell. Intercut Howell in his motel room.  He is thrown by getti this call --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get this number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
