dialogues.text: Mr. Jones is dead.  So are two of his men.  The other three are in jail.  I have the disks.  I have Walter Smith. And you know what, you motherfucker?  I have you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have your fucking family.  Don't forget that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also have a couple of million in cash. Call Sonny Benza.  Ask if I can keep it. This throws Howell, too.  He didn't expect anything like this; not from Talley --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife and my daughter and the money. I'll bring the disks to the mall by the freeway, you bring my family.  We'll trade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that!  You think I'm crazy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you got no choice. Howell thinks about it.  It's a tough call because Talley might be setting him up, but they're playing even hands-- Talley still has the disks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the mall.  You know that motel on the road west of town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got ten minutes.  If you're one minute late, we won't be here to find. Talley tosses his phone aside, then drives away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A graphic identifies our location:  New York City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor Castellano is "the old man" that Benza's people ha mentioned.  He is not a happy man in the best of circumstances and is even less happy now -- Castellano's assistant, Jamie Beldone, is briefing him on events in the West --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is in flames, Benza's accountant is with the cops, and they're stacking the bodies like cordwood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, it's a clusterfuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to let Sonny handle it.  I would've moved in when we first found out. Castellano scowls at the younger man --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by doing so, he would've known we have spies in his organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Yes, sir.  But what about the disks?  If the cops end up with the disks, we're gonna see a whole lot of heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate that Mickey Mouse bastard.  I hated his father, and I hate Sonny, too. Always with the tan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our people out there, they good people? People in the right place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny's a fuckup.  If he pulls this off, fine--life goes on.  But if the cops end up with those disks, we cut our losses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a message sent:  No fuckups allowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make the call. Vic Castellano watches Beldone depart as he considers wha about to come --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motel floats like an island of light in the middle of nowhere.  A few cars are scattered throughout the quiet  parking lot --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE RUIZ
dialogues.text: is hiding in weeds across from the motel, keeping an eye the road for Talley's approaching vehicle.  A radio transmission crackles quietly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see anything? Ruiz keys the mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. Talley steps silently behind him and presses his gun to M Ruiz's ear --

dialogues.speaker: LOU BUSTER
dialogues.text: Buster is on the dark side of thge parking lot, standing outside the pool of light in the shadows -- Gravel crunches behind him; Buster turns, and -- Talley cracks him across the face with his .45 --

dialogues.speaker: WITH TALLEY
dialogues.text: He edges along the perimeter of the parking lot, working close as he can to a Fat Man who is leaning against the g Mustang -- The door to a ground floor room opens, and Glen Howell st out.  Talley recognizes Howell from the big gold watch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Fat Man) Keep your eyes open.  He should've been here. Howell returns to the room.  The Fat Man steps away from Mustang, and -- Talley slams into his blindside, using the .45 as a club. The Fat Man staggers, and Talley wraps an arm around his in a choke hold, running him at the door -- Talley rams the Fat man into the door, knocking it open a shoving the Fat Man through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley explodes through the door with the Fat Man in fron him like a shield --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Police! Glen Howell jerks out his pistol as he drops behind the b Duane Manelli rolls out of a chair, aiming from the floor a two-handed grip --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot!  Don't shoot him! Talley shifts his aim back and forth between the two men. has his back to the wall and the Fat Man in front of him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my family?!  Where's my family, you fuck?! All three men are sucking air like freight engines.  No one is shooting, but if one person fires, everyone will f Everybody has something the other guy wants.  That's the thing holding them back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy.  Just take it easy.  We're here to do business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said they would be here, goddamnit! Where are they? Howell releases his grip on the gun, and lets it swing fr on his finger.  He's trying to cool Talley --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're close.  Let me make a call.  You can see they're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said they would be here! Howell takes out his phone and presses a number.  Talley shifts his aim from Howell to the Fat Man to Manelli --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Put on the woman. Howell offers the phone, but Talley is wary--he can't let of the Fat Man and he won't put down his pistol.  Howell carefully holds the phone to Talley's ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Jane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, we're -- Howell backs away with the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the disks? Talley takes out a single disk.  It's the one labeled 'Marlon.'  He tosses it onto the bed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the other one when I have my girls.  Not talk to them; have them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close. Howell considers the disk.  If Talley has the second disk his pocket, Howell could just shoot him.  But Howell can' sure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to see if it's real. Howell brings the disk to a lap top computer set up in th corner.  He inserts the disk, and waits for it to read. satisfied with what he sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Now the second one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First my girls.  I get my girls, you get the other disk. Howell stares at Talley again, then picks up his phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Bring them.  Stop the car outside the room, but don't get out. The car pulls up directly outside the door.  It was only seconds away.  Marion Clewes is driving; Jane and Amanda wedged into the front seat beside him, Jane next to Mario Amanda on the far side.  They are bound tight with their mouths taped, immobile and helpless, their eyes wide with fear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) Aim your gun at the woman's head.  If he doesn't give me the disk, kill her. Marion presses a gun to Jane's temple -- Talley jerks his gun toward Howell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill you!  You won't get the other disk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you shoot me, he'll kill your daughter.  Do you want to lose both of them? Talley aims at the man in the car; he aims at Howell.  He tried so hard to save his family, and now Howell has him boxed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The negotiation is over, Talley.  I won. Now give me the disk or he'll put her brain on the glass. Talley looks at Jane and Amanda, and his eyes fill.  He mouths the words --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. He's saying good-bye. Talley drops his gun and releases the Fat Man, who stumbl away.  Talley tosses a second disk onto the bed.  Manelli scoops it up and tosses it to Howell as Mation appears in door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave the other one to the Sheriffs and they're giving it to the real FBI.  This one's a fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better be kidding. Howell anxiously pushes the disk into his lap top --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a cop, you asshole!  What did you expect me to do?  Pretend all this never happened? Howell stares at the lap top with the withering face of a reading his own death sentence.  There is nothing on this disk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benza's over.  You're over.  I just want to take my family home. Howell stands like a mechanical man; incredulous --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) You fucked up, Glen. Howell looks over as if seeing Marion for the first time, gives him the order --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them. Marion aims his gun directly between Talley's eyes, then points it at Howell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fuckups allowed. Marion shoots Howell in the head, then the Fat Man, then Manelli--bambambam--one shot, one kill. He lowers his gun, considers Talley.  Talley doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a storm, isn't it?  This raging force that you can't control does whatever it wants, and the best you can do is survive.  A winner survives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why...? The question being:  Why aren't I dead?  Why aren't you killing me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good would it do to kill you?  The police already have the disk. Marion considers Talley another moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife is a very nice lady. Marion goes to his car.  He helps out Jane and Amanda, th gets into his car and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talley stumbles out of the room and runs to his family. scoops up Jane and Amanda, hugging them tightly as the ca pulls up and away, rising, leaving this reunited family a Marion Clewes disappears like a passing thunderhead --

dialogues.speaker: CLOSING CREDITS
dialogues.text: The credits roll to black, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage door slides up.  Benza backs out in his Merced then roars to the front door.  He pops the trunk, then ge out and hurries to the front door.  He sticks his head in and calls to his wife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fucking jet's waiting!  Would you get your shit out here?! He picks up two bags from inside the door and brings them the car --

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TRUNK
dialogues.text: Benza steps behind the raised trunk to put away his bags. When he steps back around again, a nondescript sedan is waiting in the drive --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fuckups allowed. Gunfire erupts on the quiet ridge above Palm Springs.
